alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hamilton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 9:03AM EST until December 20 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida, including the following counties, Baker, Columbia, Hamilton, Suwannee and Union and southeast Georgia, including the following county, Echols. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake City, Live Oak, Jasper, Lake Butler, Jennings, White Springs, Raiford, Suwannee Springs, Suwannee River State Park, Suwannee Valley, Winfield, Belmont, Five Points, Wellborn, Watertown, Lulu, Palestine Community, Providence, Crossroads and Groves. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
